data.title: Fictional Persons
data.meta_description: Index of significant fictional persons appearing in theatrically-released feature films
data.text:
Note: The following annotated index, exclusively created by Jay Robert Nash, shows fictional and supernatural persons appearing in theatrically-released feature films (chiefly U.S. and British releases, along with notable foreign productions, showing U.S. year of release), as well as feature films made-for-TV, TV series and miniseries, but does not include shorts, documentaries or video productions. Persons are presented alphabetically by first name and titles of films are sequentially presented in alphabetical and chronological order. Titles shown in boldface (which will interface to the actual full-text entries on this database) represent entries profiled in Jay Robert Nash's Internet Movie Database, with the actor or actress enacting the character shown following parenthesis after each entry.

A.J. Raffles (Arthur J. Raffles; gentleman jewel thief in London, who adeptly evades detection by Scotland Yard as he filches the gems of the rich, as first depicted in Ernest William Hornung's 1898 short story, "The Ides of March"): Raffles, The Amateur Cracksman (1917) John Barrymore; The Gentleman Thief (2001) made-for-TV, Nigel Havers; Mr. Justice Raffles (1921) Gerald Ames; Raffles (1925) House Peters; Raffles (1930) Ronald Colman; Raffles (1939) David Niven; Raffles (1975- ) TV series, Anthony Valentine; The Return of Raffles (1932) George Barraud.
